Let bump2version do it for you. -->> Version 2.1.0> bind is a function that joins strings in a way we often need## Usage```pythonfrom bind import bindthings_to_bind = ['castable', 'to', 's t r i n g.', 45, '"hi"', 0.25]# defaults for urllib.parse.quote_plus, leaving these out would change nothingkwargs = dict(safe='', encoding=None, errors=None) # by default, use slash separator and urlencodingbind(*things_to_bind, **kwargs)'castable/to/s+t+r+i+n+g./45/%22hi%22/0.25'# turn off url encodingbind(*things_to_bind, url=False, **kwargs)'castable/to/s t r i n g./45/"hi"/0.25'# result is the same if you pass in a listbind(things_to_bind, url=False, **kwargs)'castable/to/s t r i n g./45/"hi"/0.25'# change separator --- note that it strips the other . in things_to_bind[2]bind(*things_to_bind, sep='.')'castable.to.s+t+r+i+n+g.45.%22hi%22.0.25'# pointless but possible, and will strip W, H and Y from items in iterable!bind(*things_to_bind, sep='WHY', url=True, **kwargs)'castableWHYtoWHYs+t+r+i+n+g.WHY45WHY%22hi%22WHY0.25'```Aside from `url=bool` and `sep=str`, all keyword arguments are passed to [`urllib.parse.quote_plus`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/urllib.parse.html#urllib.parse.quote_plus)## Tests (300% coverage)```bashcoverage run -m unittestcoverage report --omit=tests/*``````Name Stmts Miss Cover--------------------------------------bind/__init__.py 2 0 100%bind/bind.py 10 0 100%--------------------------------------TOTAL 12 0 100%```
